title: Grocery Map
name: Grocery Map
description:
A Map by Baostar

I have always enjoyed food shopping and eating really good food. I typically spend Saturday shuttling from one store to another. This is a map of food shops I visit regularly and other nearby places I've been to.

properties.name: 99 Ranch Market
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  5402 Walnut Ave., Irvine, CA 92604One of the largest Asian supermarket chain in the United States.

properties.name: Bristol Farms
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  810 Avocado Avenue Newport Beach, CA 92660

properties.name: Claro's Italian Market
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  1095 E Main St, TustinA non-descript market tucked in the back of a shopping plaza. They carry imported Italian goods such as fresh mozzarella, olives packed in tubs, sausages tied in twine, Prosciutto Di Parma, cannolis and gelato.

properties.name: Ebisu Market
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  18930 Brookhurst Street Fountain Valley, CA 92708A small Asian market I used to go to when I lived in the area.

properties.name: El Metate Market
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  817 W. 19th St. Costa Mesa, CAEl Metate Market is a super market specializing in Mexican goods. They have an excellent deli.

properties.name: El Toro Gourmet Meats
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  23522 El Toro Road, Lake Forest, CAThis is a great meat shop and I really enjoy their own marinated carne asada, top sirloin steaks, and lobster tails. They also have other things such as pickled gherkins, jam, horseradish, fresh homemade salsa and avacodo dip etc. I think most of their meat is from local farmers and they also have freezer meat packages (the gourmet pack is 50) or you can pick your own. Located at 23522 El Toro Road, Lake Forest (look for the "Big Red Barn").

properties.name: Fresh Produce Market
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 1147 Prospect St , La Jolla, CA 92037A cute market on Prospect Street.

properties.name: Gelson's
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  5521 Alton Parkway, IrvineGelson\'s store is all about cleanliness, convenience, and service. You\'ll find unusual ingredients, special spices, and gourmet foods from the service deli like spiral ham and rib roast. The bakery offers an array of pastries and cakes that you can enjoy with coffee and sit by a cozy fireplace if you just want to relax.

properties.name: Growers Direct
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  101 E 17th St., Costa Mesa, CA 92627Growers Direct is located by the Triangle Square shopping center (oxymoron), in a messy tangle of streets (known as the "Bermuda Triangle") where the 55 freeway turns into Newport. It\'s small market mostly known by locals that sells fresh and seasonal produce at "cheap" prices that you\'d normally find at Asian or Mexican grocery stores.

properties.name: HK Market
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  14551 Red Hill Ave, Tustin, CA 92780The HK market has a bakery, food court serving Korean, Japanese and Chinese cuisine, and even a made-to-order sushi counter. But my favorite thing about the store is the packaged banchan (Korean side dishes) and tubs of pre-marinated meats, ready for grilling. The bulgogi, marinated sliced rib-eye at 2.99/lb is a bargain; tender, marinated galbi (beef short ribs) for .49/lb is also quite reasonable. Their wide selection of banchan include pickled Japanese cucumbers, seasoned spinach, green seaweed tossed with sesame oil, creamy potato salad, and marinated bean sprouts.

properties.name: Han's Market
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  14210 Culver Dr., Irvine, CA 92604A small "mom and pop" Korean market with lots of Asian seasonings, cured meats, home-made sushi and sweets.

properties.name: Henry's Marketplace
properties.description: Posted by Happycow  3030 Harbor Blvd Ste D, Costa Mesa, California, United States, North AmericaVegetarian FriendlyHealth Food StoreReviews

properties.name: Irvine Farmer's Market
properties.description: Posted by Baostar   Campus Dr, IrvineFarmer\'s market I go to is at the University Center on the corner of Bridge and Campus (across from UCI). Here you can get vegetables, fruit, mushrooms, fresh herbs, meat, fish, dairy, eggs, honey and plants from farmers in the region of Orange County. Great fun if it\'s not too crowded.

properties.name: La Carreta Supermarket
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  4637 E. Chapman Ave, Orange, CALa Carreta supermarket is located the primarily Hispanic El Modena neighborhood of Orange. The aisles are filled with Boing! Juice concentrates, Bimbo snacks, Goya spices and a meat counter with longanisa, or sausage, and marinated chicken.

properties.name: Laxmi Sweets & Spices
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  638 El Camino Real, Tustin, CALike most Indian markets, this one assaults your sense of smell before any other sense. The sleepy market is pungent with the aroma of curry, turmeric, fenugreek and cardamom, all draping around you like six yards of a sari. Laxmi has been around for 16 years and exists as a small temple of cluttered, unmanicured hominess stocked with English teas, sacks of jasmine rice, frozen meals of curry and a thriving selection of Indian movies and CDs. Pass all this by and walk to the back where a short buffet is ready every day around 11 a.m. The lamb curry is tender, vegetable meatballs sit in a creamy yellow gravy, rolled chickpea crackers are wonderful snacks. Maybe the lentil soup is too watery, but the naan, charred in spots, is never insipid. There are battered and fried potatoes that are perfectly creamy inside. And the pakoras, lentil fritters, are smooth and spicy. All this requires a sweet ending. The rice pudding is milky and flavored with cinnamon and cardamom and fat raisins. The gulab jamun are deep-fried dumplings tasting vaguely of sweetened condensed milk soaking in simple syrup. You can also fill up on plain lassi or mango lassi, both are thick, creamy slushies made from yogurt. There\'s also a vast menu of Indian specialties, including parathas (stuffed pan-roasted wheat breads), outstanding biryanis (a pile of saffron-yellow rice flecked with spices and mixed with tender lamb or chicken), and vegetarian dishes such as baingan bharta (lucious eggplant simmered with onions and cinnamon) and aloo-poori (spicy potatoes served with deep-fried whole wheat bread). You\'ll be shocked by the length of dosas - they\'ll seem like baseball bats. The large, diaphanous crepe is rolled around a filling of spicy potato and served with two sauces, one is made of coconut, the other tart and bright red from tomato. On the same plate is a dark pickle that\'s as assaulting as anything you\'ve evertasted. The tika masala is one of a few dishes where spices take a back seat to a sweet, creamy gravy. It\'s excellent with either lamb or chicken. Someone in the kitchen here is making this soul food with imprecision, and yet, it\'ll sink permanently into your psyche. -ocregister

properties.name: Marukai Japanese Market
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  2975 Harbor Blvd., Costa Mesa, CA 92626-3912

properties.name: Mitsuwa Marketplace
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  665 Paularino Ave., Costa Mesa CA 92626Shopping at Mitsuwa has a slightly "Lost in Translation" feel. Most of the staff and shoppers are Japanese. There are vivid, anime-style banners hanging above the aisles, which are stocked with colorfully packaged candies, snack foods and drinks. Small booth-like shops and restaurants line the inside perimeter of the Mitsuwa Marketplace.

properties.name: Mother's Market & Kitchen
properties.description: Posted by Baobot 2963 Michelson, Irvine, CA, United StatesA health-conscious grocery store with a large selection of vitamins. Also offers kitchen for dining. (Jessica Peralta)

properties.name: Penzeys Spices
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 21301 Hawthorne Blvd, Torrance, CAStepping into Penzeys Spice store makes you feel like you are in a far away land. The store aroma takes you to fields growing cinnamon or basil and to the many far away lands where Penzeys gathers its fresh spices. They offers over 250 fresh spices, blends and flavors that you can buy in different quantities, from very small amounts such as two oz. in a miniature bottle to bags holding 8 oz. or more. Every spice can be "smelled" with their sample jars. Penzeys offerings are also available in the store online, by phone or via email order.

properties.name: Super Irvine Market
properties.description: Posted by Baostar   14120 Culver Drive, Suite #B, Irvine, CA 92604Super Irvine Market has a similar inventory as Wholesome Choice, but often has deals on items not at Wholesome Choice. There isn\'t a food court, but its located next to Darband (Iranian restaurant), Caspian (Iranian restaurant), India Cook House (Indian restaurant), Assal bakery (Iranian bakery), a Chinese bakery and a Korean soft tofu restaurant.

properties.name: Tanaka Farms
properties.description: Posted by Baostar53803/4 University Dr., Irvine, California 92612Organically home grown strawberries, tomatoes, white corn, pumpkins and christmas trees.

properties.name: Trader Joe's
properties.description: Posted by Transfairusa fair trade

properties.name: Trader Joe's
properties.description: Posted by Transfairusa fair trade

properties.name: Whole Foods Market
properties.description: Posted by Happycow14945 Holt Ave, Tustin, California, United States, North AmericaVegetarian FriendlyHealth Food StoreReviews

properties.name: Wholesome Choice Market
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  18040 Culver Drive, Irvine, CAWholesome Choice offers American brands, plus an impressive line of Asian, Mediterranean, Russian, Eastern European, and even have South African foods. They have the natural and organic foods you\'ve come to expect, along with delicious market-fresh produce that arrives daily. There\'s a hearthstone bakery, located at the front of the store, where you can see speciality breads baked throughout the day. Their international food court caters to all cultures and all the locals can be typically seen eating in the dining area.
